CatDescriptText: Mrs. Rosalie Butler, caseworker, 6617 Lyric Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the Federal Government should provide financial aid for students of exceptional ability to further their education when the students are unable to do so for themselves?" answer reads: "Yes, I think so, because there are so many cases where people of high intelligence are in the lower income bracket and, therefore, can't afford a college education. It seems that for the benefit of the educational system this is not only necessary, but expedient...It seems to me that we are losing worthwhile talents, and other countries, especially Russia, are exceeding us..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Rosalie Butler wearing dark herringbone coat with high buttoned collar, holding paper bag and binder, standing in front of flecked granite wall
